faction_profile.name: 모산파 (Mosan Sect / 茅山派)
alias: Mosan Fulu Sect (모산부록파 / 茅山符籙派)

location.mountain: Mt. Mao (Mosan / 茅山) - Originally Mt. Juqu (구곡산).
location.history: Named after the Three Mao Brothers (Mao Ying, Mao Gu, Mao Zhong) who attained Tao here.

heritage.founder: Wei Huacun (위화존 / 魏華存) - A female Taoist, daughter of a Western Jin chancellor. Unique for having a female founder.
heritage.key_figure: Tao Hongjing (도홍경 / 9th Grandmaster) - Known as 'Huayang Yinju'. Elevated the sect's magical prowess.
heritage.focus: Bang-sul (Arts), Do-sul (Magic), Ju-sul (Sorcery) rather than physical Martial Arts.

status.alignment: Neutral / Grey (Technically Taoist/Orthodox, but their methods involve ghosts and corpses, making them seem Unorthodox/Sapa).
status.role: Exorcists (civilian level) or Occult Specialists (Murim level).

combat_style.weakness: Physically weak compared to martial artists. Relies on preparations, formations, and distance.

specialty: Jiangshi Control (강시술): Manipulating corpses to fight.
Soul Manipulation: Calling or binding spirits.

core_scripture.name: 상청경 태동진경 (Shangqing Scripture Taidong True Sutra)
core_scripture.description: The ultimate grimoire of Mosan, compiling all their spells and methods.

sensory.name: 귀이술법 (Ghost Ear Art)
sensory.effect: Amplifies hearing by borrowing a ghost's ears. Hears whispers from afar.

binding.name: 반심술 (Reverse Heart Art)
binding.effect: Blocks the flow of the opponent's Qi.

list.name: 사령귀혼대법 (Evil Spirit Soul Return Great Art)
list.effect: Summons the souls of the dead.

list.name: 생사환위요상술 (Life Death Exchange Healing Art)
list.effect: Transfers injuries or life force (Mystic Healing).

list: 생사회혼대법 (Life Death Return Soul Great Art)

formations: 삼라환상기환술 (Forest of Illusions Strange Magic Art) - Traps enemies in hallucinations.

narrative_role: The 'Occult Detective' who solves supernatural mysteries (hauntings, curses).
A support character who buffs allies or debuffs enemies with talismans.
A faction that controls an army of Jiangshi (Hopping Vampires), serving as a terrifying force.
The bridge between the living and the dead, often misunderstood by the 'righteous' sword sects.
